name: Abbey
cardText: Progress is not the only thing here; you also get red wine and lots of dark beer.

name: Abbey Brewery
cardText: Place adjacent to a fields region. If you pay 2 grain from the adjacent fields region, you may rotate the Abbey Brewery to any side of your choice.

name: Academy of Sages
cardText: 1x during your turn: Pay any 1 resource of your choice and rotate any 1 sage card to the next higher level.

name: Age of Enlightenment
cardText: You receive any 1 resource of your choice for each victory point on the Manifesto of Humane Conduct card.

name: Alliance Against the Barbarians
Requires: 1 unit and 1 VP on Triumph Card
cardText: Each player who has at least 1 unit takes any 1 resource of his choice. The player who has the most units takes up to 1 additional resource.

name: Ambassador
cardText: You get the advantage of discovering the Island of the Bards, the Island of the Scholars, or the Island of the Merchants another time.
protectionOrRemoval: Pilgrimage Site

name: Aqueduct
cardText: If the number of a fields or pasture region adjacent to the city with the Aqueduct is rolled, you receive 1 additional resource there.

name: Archer
cardText: Your opponent must place 1 of his own units with at least 1 strength point under a matching draw stack.
protectionOrRemoval: Lookout Tower, Heinrich the Sentinel, Master of the Brotherhood, Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Armory
cardText: No more diplomatic misunderstandings! People understand our language everywhere.

name: Arnd the Strategist
cardText: When a Barbarian Attack occurs, each hero in the settlement/city where Arnd is placed counts double – except for Arnd himself.

name: Arsenal
cardText: In case of a Brigand Attack, the resources of the regions adjacent to the Arsenal are neither counted nor stolen.

name: Arsonist
cardText: Choose 1 of your opponent’s buildings adjacent to a settlement/city. He must place it under a draw stack of his choice.
protectionOrRemoval: Fire Brigade, Lookout Tower, Heinrich the Sentinel, Master of the Brotherhood, Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Artwork: Epic
cardText: You receive 1 star. If you have a Theater, you receive another 1 star.

name: Artwork: Fountain
cardText: You receive 1 star. If you have an Aqueduct, you receive another 1 star.

name: Artwork: Relief
cardText: You receive 1 star. If you have a City Palace, you receive another 1 star.

name: Artwork: Sculpture
cardText: You receive 1 star. If you have a Builder’s Hut, you receive another 1 star.

name: Astronomer
cardText: 1x during your turn: If you have discovered fewer sea cards than your opponent, you may pay 1 gold to carry our a second journey of exploration.

name: Austin
cardText: If you hit my left cheek, don’t even think you’ll have time to hit the right one too.

name: Balliwick
cardText: 1x during your turn: You may draw the top card from a draw stack (from your own draw stack).

name: Barbara, Sage of the Fields
cardText: Place adjacent to a fields region with at least 1 grain. Pay this grain. If the number of the adjoining fields region is rolled during the production roll, rotate Barbara to the next higher level.

name: Barbarian Attack
Requires: City. Advantages: Units, Arnd the Strategist, Caravel, Castle, Border Fortress
cardText: A player who has fewer units than victory points from cities, Metropolises, and city expansions discards 2 resources. A player who has more units and at least 1 city receives 2 resources. Afterwards: The card is placed under the 4 top cards of the event card stack.
protectionOrRemoval: Secret Brotherhood, Castle, Arnd the Strategist, Caravel

name: Barbarian Stronghold
cardText: Place on a free road adjacent to one of your oppponent’s cities. For your opponent, the strength of the barbarians increases by 1.
protectionOrRemoval: Your opponent’s Triumph Card indicates 3 victory points.

name: Baroc the Barbarian
cardText: After a Brigand Attack, you receive 1 ore. If there is a Barbarian Stronghold in your opponent’s principality, you receive 2 ore.

name: Bath House
cardText: Protects all 4 regions bordering this city from the effects of the event Plague.

name: Benjamin the Traveling Scholar
cardText: You once more receive the resource of each region whose number you rolled at the beginning of your turn.

name: Bera the Insurrectionist
cardText: You choose: Your opponent either gives you up to 2 stars, or he gives you 1 resource of his choice for each victory point he has in excess of your own victory point total – up to a maximum of 3 resources.

name: Bishop
cardText: Demand 1 gold from your opponent. In addition, you receive as much gold as you can accommodate in one of your gold fields or in the Gold Cache.

name: Bishop’s See
cardText: If you build the Bishop’s See, you may choose 3 of your opponent’s units. He must remove 1 of them and place it on the discard pile (on his own discard pile).

name: Border Fortress
cardText: Place adjacent to a hills region where at least 1 brick is stored. Pay this brick. For 1 ore + 1 wool, you may rotate the Border Fortress to the next higher level.

name: Bran, Defender of the Temple
cardText: Place on your Temple. Draw immediately 2 cards from the draw stacks (from your own draw stacks). Your Temple is protected against all action cards, effects of expansion cards, and events.

name: Brick Factory
cardText: Doubles the brick production of the neighboring hills.

name: Brick Ship
cardText: During your turn, you may trade 2 brick for any 1 other resource as often as you wish.

name: Brigand Camp
cardText: Place on a free road of your opponent. Your opponent’s commerce points are reduced by 1. If your opponent uses his Markerplace to store 1 resource, you receive 1 gold.

name: Brigands
cardText: You may take as many resources of the same type from your opponent as 1 of your regions can accommodate.

name: Brigitta, the Wise Woman
cardText: Play this card before rolling the dice. Choose the result of the production die roll.

name: Broadside
cardText: Your opponent must either rotate 1 Island card to the next lower level or turn 1 explorer ship over (so that its blank side faces up) - you choose.

name: Builder’s Hut
cardText: (1) If the event Celebration is rolled, you receive 1 star. (2) A building that costs at least 6 resources costs you 1 resource less.

name: Building Crane
cardText: Every city expansion you build that costs more than 4 resources costs you 1 resource less.

name: Candamir
cardText: A well-sharpened axe is a tried and tested starting position for a successful conversation.

name: Cannon Foundry
cardText: 1x during your turn: If you lose against a pirate, you may repeat the die roll once.

name: Capricious Sea
cardText: Calm Sea (1, 2, 3, 4): For each of his own trade ships, each player receives any 1 resource of his choice. Storm (5, 6): Each player slides one of the trade ships he placed in his principality under a matching draw stack (under a matching draw stack of his own).
protectionOrRemoval: Lighthouse, Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Caravel
cardText: Each ship in the settlement/city where the Caravel is placed counts double in case of a Barbarian Attack – except for the Caravel itself.

name: Carl Forkbeard
cardText: What a beautiful island! I take it.

name: Cartographer
cardText: View up to 2 of your face-down sea cards and/or switch ths positions of any 2 sea cards of your choice in your principality.

name: Castellan
cardText: The two regions adjacent to your Castle each receive 1 resource – if storage space is available.

name: Castle
cardText: In case of a Barbarian Attack, each strength point of your Border Fortress counts as 1 additional unit.

name: Chapel
cardText: If a 1, 2, or 3 / 4, 5, or 6 is rolled with the production die, the event Riots does not apply to you.

name: Chief Cannoneer
cardText: I’ll show you how to produce a romantic castle ruin.

name: Church
cardText: After building the Church, you immediately receive up to 2 gold.

name: Cimmarone
cardText: Discovery/Mission: Pay 1 gold or fight. Fight: Roll the production die and add up the cannons. Victory: Rotate the card to the next higher level and take the bounty. Defeat: You lose your ship (turn the disc token over so that its blank side faces up). Tie: Roll the production die again!
protectionOrRemoval: Cannon Foundry

name: City
cardText: Place card on a settlement. 4 building sites for red and green.

name: City Palace
cardText: 1x during your turn: Pay 3 stars and draw 1 action card (the cardText must not include a requirement) or a unit from the discard pile (from your own discard pile) into your hand.

name: Cloth Merchant’s Residence
cardText: Place adjacent to a pasture region. For 2 wool from the adjacent pasture region, you may rotate the Residence to the next higher level.

name: Cole, Paladin of the Sages
cardText: 1x during your turn: You may use the function of one of your opponent’s groves if you pay the number of owls indicated on that grove.

name: Commercial Harbor
cardText: 1x during your turn: Downgrade 1 of your Residences by 1 level and take any 2 resources of your choice.

name: Commercial Metropolis
Requires: 6 CP or 1 Residence at the highest level
cardText: Place on a “City” card.

name: Common Land
cardText: 1x during your turn: Pay 1 star to trade any 1 resource of your choice for 1 different resource.

name: Contest of the Heroes
cardText: Determine 1 of your own heroes and 1 hero of your opponent (if he has one). Each player rolls the production die and adds up his respective strength points. In case of a tie: roll the die again. The winner receives 1 resource and may demand another 1 resource from the loser.

name: Council of the Sages
cardText: Each player may distribute, at his own discretion, either up to 2 owls among his sages or up to 2 resources among regions with an adjacent sage.

name: Court Astrologer
cardText: If you play this card and pay 1 star, you may once more determine an event die roll result during your turn.

name: Courthouse
cardText: If you lose resources when the event Trade is rolled, you determine which resources to give to your opponent.

name: Craft Guild
cardText: After building the Craft Guild: Rotate each of your Residences to the next higher level. If you don’t have a Residence you could rotate to the next higher level, you receive any 2 resources of your choice instead.

name: Dispute of the Sages
cardText: You and your opponent roll the production die, and each adds his sages’ owls to his result. The winner receives any 2 resources of his choice. Tie: Both players each receive 1 resource.

name: Doctor
cardText: Each region bordering your Bath House receives 1 resource. If you have various Bath Houses, you may only use 1 of them.

name: Drill Ground
cardText: Each hero you build in your principality costs you 1 resource of your choice less.

name: Explorer Harbor
cardText: Building an explorer ship (turn the disc token over) costs 1 lumber and 1 wool. You may only make 1 discovery during each of your turns.

name: Explorer Metropolis
Requires: 6 discovered sea cards or 2 level 3 islands
cardText: Place on the city adjacent to the Explorer Harbor.

name: Fairgrounds
cardText: If you have more skill points than your opponent, you immediately receive 2 resources of your choice after building the Fairground.

name: Famine
cardText: Each player without a Granary must discard 1 grain. If a player doesn’t have grain, he must discard 2 resources of his choice.
protectionOrRemoval: Granary

name: Feeding the Poor
cardText: Pay 1 grain. You receive up to 2 stars.

name: Feud
cardText: The player who has the strength advantage selects 3 of his opponent’s buildings. The opponent must remove one of them and return it to the bottom of a matching draw stack.
protectionOrRemoval: Sebastian the Itinerant Preacher, Grove of Courage, Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Fire Brigade
cardText: This city’s buildings are safe from the Arsonist.

name: Fortunate Trade Voyage
cardText: For 1 of his trade ships, each player receives up to 2 resources of the type traded by the ship. Large Trade Ship: Each player receives 2 resources of the left or right region.

name: Fraternal Feuds
cardText: The player who has the strength advantage selects 2 cards from the opponent’s hand and returns them to the bottom of matching draw stacks.
protectionOrRemoval: Sebastian the Itinerant Preacher, Grove of Courage, Pilgrimage Site

name: Frederich, Sage of the Hills
cardText: Place adjacent to a hills region with at least 1 brick. Pay this brick. If the number of the adjoining hills region is rolled during the production roll, rotate Frederich to the next higher level.

name: Friendship Between Peoples
cardText: Each player receives any 1 resource of his choice for each Island card he has rotated at least to the next higher level.

name: Gero the Master Merchant
cardText: Take any 1 or 2 resources of your choice.

name: Gift for the Prince
cardText: Each player receives 1 gold for each unit with at least 1 strength point.

name: Godfrey the Intriguer
cardText: If you built Godfrey, during your next turns you may pay 1 gold to view the cards in your opponent’s hand and take 1 unit or action card. If you take 1 card, place Godfrey on the discard pile (on your own discard pile).
protectionOrRemoval: If you take 1 unit or action card from your opponent’s hand

name: Gold Cache
cardText: The gold cache may also be used to store the gold you received. When the event Brigand Attack is rolled, the gold in the cache is neither counted nor stolen.

name: Gold Ship
cardText: During your turn, you may trade 2 gold for any 1 other resource as often as you wish.

name: Goldsmith
cardText: Discard 3 gold and take any 2 resources of your choice in return.

name: Good Neighbors
cardText: Reveal the top cards of all draw stacks. The player who has the Pilgrimage Site receives any 1 resource of his choice. The player who has Odin’s Fountain draws 1 card from 1 draw stack (from 1 of his own stacks) into his hand.

name: Grain Mill
cardText: Doubles the grain production of the neighboring fields.

name: Grain Ship
cardText: During your turn, you may trade 2 grain for any 1 other resource as often as you wish.

name: Granary
cardText: 1x during your turn: If one of your opponent’s fields regions has no grain, you may give him 1 grain, which he must store in this fields region. Afterwards, demand any 1 resource of a different type of your choice from him.

name: Great Foresight
cardText: View the event card stack and remove – without changing the order of the cards – 1 event (except for the Yule).

name: Great Thingstead
cardText: Both players may no longer play action-attack cards. The event Religious Dispute no longer affects any of the players.

name: Grove of Courage
cardText: If, during your own or your opponent’s turn, you were to lose cards from your hand or buildings due to a Feud or Fraternal Feud these event cards would have no effect.

name: Grove of Fraternity
cardText: 1x during your turn: You may draw 3 cards from any 1 or more draw stack(s) of your choice (from any 1 or more of your own draw stacks of your choice). Afterwards, your opponent may draw 1 card from any draw stack of his choice (from any of his own draw stacks of his choice).

name: Grove of Freedom
cardText: 1x during your turn: Choose 1 card from a draw stack (from one of your own draw stacks).

name: Grove of Great Foresight
cardText: 1x during your turn: You may view the 3 topmost event cards, You may place as many of these event cards under the stack as you like, except for the Yule card.

name: Grove of Justice
cardText: Use this card before your dice roll and determine the result of the event die roll.

name: Grove of Peace
cardText: Roll the production die if your opponent plays an action attack card. If the roll result is larger than 3, the card has no effect and your opponent must place it on the discard pile.

name: Grove of Vigilance
cardText: If the event Trade, Celebration, or Brigand Attack is rolled, you may declare the event void. Instead, the event Event Card applies.

name: Gudrun, Terror of the Seas
Requires: At least 1 Pirate Ship and your opponent has at least 1 gold
cardText: For each of your Pirate Ships, your opponent must give you up to 2 gold.

name: Guido the Ambassador
cardText: You may choose 1 card from the discard pile (Tournament: from your opponent’s discard pile).

name: Guild Master
cardText: Take up to 2 resources of your choice.

name: Gustav the Librarian
cardText: You may choose 1 card from the discard pile (Tournament: from your own discard pile).

name: Haidao Chang
cardText: Discovery/Mission: Pay 1 gold or fight. Fight: Roll the production die and add up the cannons. Victory: Rotate the card to the next higher level and take the bounty. Defeat: You lose your ship (turn the disc token over so that its blank side faces up). Tie: Roll the production die again!
protectionOrRemoval: Cannon Foundry

name: Harald
cardText: I knock you out faster than you can carve the word “strategy” in this stone.

name: Harbor
cardText: As long as at least 3 trade ships are placed in your principality, the Harbor is worth 1 victory point.

name: Hedge Tavern
cardText: In the neighborhood, word has it that more people were seen going inside than coming out.

name: Heinrich the Sentinel
cardText: When your opponent plays an Archer, Arsonist, or Traitor, roll the dice. If you roll a 3, 4, or 5, the card has no effect.

name: Hergild the Master Merchent
Requires: Commercial Harbor or at least 2 trade ships
cardText: During the turn you play Hergild, you may trade a resource type for which you have 1 trade ship at a 1:1 rate as often as you like.

name: Hospital
cardText: 1x during your turn: You receive 1 star, or you pay 1 star and receive any 1 resource of your choice in exchange.

name: Hour of the Master Merchants
cardText: Rotate each of your Residences to the next higher level. If 1 or more Residences already reached level 3, each region adjacent to these Residence(s) receives 1 resource instead.

name: Inga
cardText: The gods are expecting more offerings. And they expect you to hand them over to me!

name: Insurrection
cardText: Each player has to remove 1 of his own buildings that costs at least 2 resources and place it under a matching draw stack (under one of his own matching draw stacks). Afterwards: The Insurrection is placed under the 4 top cards of the event card stack.
protectionOrRemoval: Public Feeling (pay 1 star), Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Invention
cardText: Each player gets any 1 resource of his choice for each building with a progress point – up to a maximum of 2 resources.

name: Irmgard, Keeper of the Light
cardText: If you lose a card of your principality due to an event or an action, you receive any 1 resource of your choice.

name: Iron Foundry
cardText: Doubles the ore production of the neighboring mountains.

name: Island of the Bards
cardText: Discovery: Your opponent shows you his hand of cards, from which you may draw 1 action card or unit unto your hand. Mission: Pay 2 grain to rotate the card to the next higher level.
protectionOrRemoval: Pilgrimage Site

name: Island of the Forgotten Tribe
cardText: Discovery: Return the ship to the Explorer Harbor. You may carry out an additional mission. Mission: Roll the production die! 1: Reef – you lose your ship (turn the disc token over so that its blank side faces up). 2-4: Roll the event die. 5-6: Treasure – rotate the card to the next higher level.

name: Island of the Merchants
cardText: Discovery: You may immediately trade any 1 resource of your choice for any 2 other resources of your choice. Mission: Pay 2 wool to rotate the card to the next higher level.

name: Island of the Scholars
cardText: Discovery: You may choose up to 2 cards from any 1 draw stack of your choice (from any 1 of your own draw stacks of your choice) and draw them into your hand. Mission: Pay 2 lumber to rotate the card to the next higher level.

name: Jean
cardText: Discovery/Mission: Pay 2 resources or fight. Fight: Roll the production die and add up the cannons. Victory: Rotate the card to the next higher level and take the bounty. Defeat: You lose your ship (turn the disc token over so that its blank side faces up). Tie: Roll the production die again!
protectionOrRemoval: Cannon Foundry

name: Judith, Guardian of the Church
cardText: Place on your Church. Your Church is protected against all action cards, effects of expansion cards, and events. 1x during your turn: Pay 1 resource (no gold); you receive up to 2 gold.

name: Landing Stage
cardText: Place above or below a region directly adjacent to your Explorer Harbor. 1x during your turn: On a mission to the Island of the Bards, Island of the Scholars, or Island of the Merchants, you may replace 1 of the resources you have to pay with 1 gold.

name: Large Festival Hall
cardText: Just a moment! Didn’t the estimate specify a much bigger tower?

name: Large Trade Ship
cardText: You may trade 2 resources of the left or right neighboring region for any 1 other resource of your choice.

name: Lars the Naval Hero
cardText: When you fight against a pirate, the die roll is omitted and the pirate is defeated.

name: Library
cardText: When you build the Library, you may immediately choose a card from a draw stack (Tournament: from your own stack).

name: Lighthouse
Requires: Commercial Harbor or at least 2 trade ships
cardText: 1x during your turn: If you built a trade ship directly adjacent to the Lighthouse, you may use this ship to trade at a 1:1 rate. You don’t lose a trade ship when the event Capricious Sea occurs.

name: Lookout Tower
cardText: When your opponent plays an Archer, Arsonist, or Traitor, roll the dice. If you roll a 1 or 2, the card has no effect.

name: Lumber Camp
cardText: Doubles the lumber production of the neighboring forests.

name: Lumber Ship
cardText: During your turn, you may trade 2 lumber for any 1 other resource as often as you wish.

name: Manifesto of Humane Conduct
cardText: Pay 1 lumber, 2 gold, and 3 owls to rotate the card to the next higher level. For 2 of the owls you have to pay, you also may place 1 action attack card on the discard pile.

name: Marie the Shieldmaiden
cardText: During one of your following turns, you may demand that your opponent chooses 2 of his heroes that can be placed on Marie’s building site. Place 1 of them on Marie’s building site. Place Marie on the discard pile (on your own discard pile).
protectionOrRemoval: After use

name: Maritime Trade Monopoly
cardText: For each trade ship you have in excess of your opponent’s trade ship total, demand 1 resource from him – up to a maximum of 2 resources.

name: Marketplace
cardText: If a production number is rolled that appears more frequently on your opponent’s regions than on yours, you receive 1 resource. Choose a resource your opponent can normally receive.

name: Master Merchants' Alliance
cardText: Each time your opponent trades 2 or 3 resources of one type for 1 different resource in his principality, ypu receive 1 resource of the type your opponent paid during this trade.

name: Master of the Brotherhood
Requires: Not having or building an Abbey.
cardText: If your opponent wants to play 1 action card that could cause the loss of 1 card of your hand or of 1 of the cards you placed, he first must pay 2 gold for each victory point he has in excess of your own victory point total. You receive up to 1 gold.

name: Mendicants
cardText: If your opponent has the trade advantage, demand 1 resource from him. If he also has more victory points than you, demand up to 2 resources from him.

name: Mercenaries
cardText: You may keep 1 gold and 1 wool when the event Brigand Attack occurs; if you pay 1 star, you keep all resources.

name: Merchant
cardText: Take up to 2 resources of your choice from your opponent and give him 1 resource of your choice in return.

name: Merchant Caravan
cardText: Discard exactly 2 of your resources and take any 2 resources of your choice in return.

name: Merchant Guild
cardText: Money can’t buy you happiness. But taking it away from others can.

name: Michael the Master Builder
cardText: Play this card when you build a building. Substitute 1, 2, or 3 of the resources required for building with 1 gold each.

name: Michaela, Sage of the Pasture
cardText: Place adjacent to a pasture region with at least 1 wool. Pay this wool. If the number of the adjoining pasture region is rolled during the production roll, rotate Michaela to the next higher level.

name: Mineral Mining
cardText: You receive up to 2 ore.

name: Mint
cardText: Once per each of your turns, you may use this Mint to trade 1 gold for 1 other resource of your choice.

name: Missionary
cardText: Your opponent must remove any 1 of the heroes he placed. Place the hero in your principality or on the discard pile (on your own discard pile).
protectionOrRemoval: Master of the Brotherhood, Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Moneylender
cardText: If you have the trade advantage and the event Trade is rolled on the event die, you may take 2 resources of your choice from your opponent.

name: Monument to the Prince
cardText: After you have built the Monument, your opponent must determine 2 of the units he placed. Choose 1 of them and add it to your hand.

name: Most Successful Explorer
cardText: The player who discovered the most sea cards in his principality (at least 1) may draw up to 2 cards from any 1 draw stack of his choice (from any 1 of his own draw stacks of his choice). Tie: Each player may draw 1 card. The player whose turn it is begins.

name: Navigator
cardText: Return 1 of your ships you have used for an action to your Explorer Harbor. You may perform another action with this ship.

name: Odin’s Fountain
cardText: At the end of your turn, you may exchange 2 cards instead of 1. If you choose the cards, each time you do so you must pay the respective costs.

name: Odin’s Priest
cardText: Your opponent must show you the cards in his hand and place all action cards and units under matching stacks (under his own matching stacks).
protectionOrRemoval: Pilgrimage Site, Master of the Brotherhood

name: Odin’s Temple
cardText: After building the Temple, immediately draw 1 card froma ny draw stack (from any of your own draw stacks).

name: Olaf the Merchant Ship Captain
cardText: During one of your following turns, you may demand 1 or 2 resources from your opponent and give him any 1 resource of your choice in return. Afterwards, place Olaf on the discard pile (on your own discard pile).
protectionOrRemoval: After use

name: Ore Ship
cardText: During your turn, you may trade 2 ore for any 1 other resource as often as you wish.

name: Osmund
cardText: When it comes to gold and women, friendship stops. And it also stops when it comes to power. Actually, friendship never lasts very long.

name: Paper Merchant’s Residence
cardText: Place adjacent to a forest region. For 2 lumber from the adjacent forest region, you may rotate the Residence to the next higher level.

name: Parish Hall
cardText: You pay only 1 resource for choosing a card from a draw stack.

name: Parliament
cardText: For the benefit of the people and their representatives in particular.

name: Peter, Sage of the Forest
cardText: Place adjacent to a forest region with at least 1 lumber. Pay this lumber. If the number of the adjoining forest region is rolled during the production roll, rotate Peter to the next higher level.

name: Pharmacy
cardText: When the event Plague occurs, you receive any 1 resource of your choice. You receive this resource whether you previously lost resources or not.

name: Piet, Sage of the Mountains
cardText: Place adjacent to a mountains region with at least 1 ore. Pay this ore. If the number of the adjoining mountains region is rolled during the production roll, rotate Piet to the next higher level.

name: Pilgrimage Site
cardText: If – by means of an event or an action card played by your opponent – you lose any of the cards in your hand, draw as many cards from any of the draw stacks (from any of your own draw stacks) as you need to replenish your hand up to the allowed number of cards.

name: Pirate Ship
cardText: Your opponent must remove 1 trade ship of his choice from his principality and place it on the discard pile. Event Plentiful Harvest: You receive 1 gold.

name: Plague
cardText: Every region bordering a city loses 1 resource.
protectionOrRemoval: Bath House

name: Power of the Groves
cardText: You receive 1 owl for each grove in your principality. You may distribute the owls among your sages as desired.

name: Priestess of the Norns
cardText: Choose 1 draw stack and select up to 2 cards from it.

name: Prince
cardText: 1x during your turn: For 1 gold, you may retrieve 1 Artwork from the discard pile (from your own discard pile). The Prince never changes over to the oppponent’s principality or to the cards in his hand.

name: Princess
cardText: 1x during your turn: For 1 gold, you may retrieve 1 Artwork from the discard pile (from your own discard pile). The Princess never changes over to the oppponent’s principality or to the cards in his hand.

name: Principal Sage Woman
cardText: Place adjacent to any region of your choice with at least 1 resource. Pay this resource. If the number of the adjoining region is rolled during the production roll, rotate the Principal Sage Woman to the next higher level.

name: Prosperity
cardText: Building a city costs you only 1 ore and 2 grain.

name: Public Feeling
cardText: If you pay 1 star, the events Riots and Insurrection do not affect you. 1x during your turn: For 2 stars, you receive any 1 resource of your choice.

name: Red Light Tavern
cardText: Place on a free road of your opponent. In the adjacent settlements/cities, for each unit featuring strength points the number of strength points is reduced to 1; all other properties remain unchanged.
protectionOrRemoval: The opponent has at least 3 heroines.

name: Field
cardText: Gains resources based on production die roll. 1 building site for brown.

name: Mountain
cardText: Gains resources based on production die roll. 1 building site for brown.

name: Gold Field
cardText: Gains resources based on production die roll. 1 building site for brown.

name: Hill
cardText: Gains resources based on production die roll. 1 building site for brown.

name: Forest
cardText: Gains resources based on production die roll. 1 building site for brown.

name: Pasture
cardText: Gains resources based on production die roll. 1 building site for brown.

name: Reiner the Herald
cardText: Play this card before rolling the dice and determine the event Celebration. You receive 1 additional resource for the Celebration.

name: Reiner the Miller
cardText: Place adjacent to a fields region. You may trade grain of this fields region for resources of different types at a 2:1 rate. If you have a Grain Mill adjacent to this fields region, 1x during your turns you may also trade at a 1:1 rate.

name: Religious Dispute
Requires: City. Advantages: Sacrificial Site, Bishop’s See
cardText: Players who have at least 1 city place all cards in their hands under matching expansion stacks (under their own matching expansion stacks). The Church and the Temple each decrease losses by 2 cards. If you have a Sacrificial Site, you receive up to 3 wool. If you have a Bishop’s See, you receive up to 3 gold.
protectionOrRemoval: Great Thingstead, Church, Odin’s Temple, Pilgrimage Site

name: Relocation
cardText: You may exchange 2 of your own regions or 2 of your own expansion cards. Resources stored on regions may not be changed and card placement rules must be followed.

name: Retreat of the Barbarians
cardText: A player who has at least 1 unit chooses 1 card from 1 draw stack (from 1 of his own draw stacks). A player who has at least 1 unit and the strength advantage chooses up to 2 cards from 1 draw stack (from 1 of his own draw stacks).

name: Riots
cardText: A player who has 1 or 2 units with strength points or commerce points pays 1 gold. A player who has more than 2 of these units pays 2 gold. If a player doesn’t pay, he must remove one of these units and return it to the bottom of a matching draw stack.
protectionOrRemoval: Chapel, Sebastian the Itinerant Preacher, Public Feeling (pay 1 star), Irmgard, Keeper of the Light

name: Road
cardText: Allows construction of a new settlement and of road complements.

name: Robert, Herald of the Sages
cardText: Each time you must roll the production die to surpass either a certain number indicated on a card or the number rolled by your opponent, you win also in case of a tie.

name: Sacrificial Site
cardText: You may trade wool for resources of a different type at a 2:1 rate. Wool from neighboring pasture regions is neither counted nor lost when the event Brigand Attack occurs.

name: Sailmakers’ Shop
cardText: Should you experience prolonged calms – we also sell rum.

name: Salt Silo
cardText: Each of your trade ships is worth 1 more commerce point.

name: Scout
cardText: Play this card when building a settlement. Take 2 cards of your choice from the region card stack. Reshuffle the region card stack.

name: Sebastian the Itinerant Preacher
cardText: If you play this card when the events Riots, Feud, or Fraternal Feud occur, these events do not apply to you.

name: Secret Brotherhood
cardText: (1) If you lose against the barbarians, you only have to pay 1 resource. (2) 1x during your turn: If you discard an unplayed unit or action card, you receive any 1 resource of your choice.

name: Settlement
cardText: Two new regions. 2 building sites for green.

name: Ship Builder
cardText: Each ship you build in your principality costs you either 1 lumber or 1 wool less. For 1 gold, you may take 1 trade ship from the discard pile (from your own discard pile).

name: Shipwreck
cardText: Discovery: You receive any 1 resource of your choice. Missions to the Shipwreck are not possible.

name: Shipyard
cardText: Place above or below a region directly adjacent to your Explorer Harbor. 1x during your turn: You may trade any 1 resource of your choice for 1 lumber or 1 wool.

name: Siegfried, Vanquisher of the Barbarians
cardText: Take 1 or 2 resources of your choice or rotate your Triumph Card to the next higher level.

name: Siglind
cardText: Turning men into heroes belittles the importance of being a hero.

name: Siward the Scout
cardText: 1x during your turn: You may view the 3 top cards of the event card stack or of any draw stack (of any of your own draw stacks) for free, or you may pay 1 gold to view the cards in your opponent’s hand.

name: Small Market Town
cardText: 1x during your turn: If one of your regions has 3 resources, you may trade 1 of these resources for any 1 different resource.

name: Staple House
cardText: If you build the Staple House, you immediately receive 2 resources of your choice.

name: Storehouse
cardText: Do not count the resources on the 2 neighboring regions when the event Brigand Attack is rolled.

name: Tactical Retreat
cardText: If you remove one of the buildings you placed in your opponent’s principality, you receive any 2 resources of your choice, 1 of which your opponent must give you.

name: Taxation
cardText: Each player who pays 1 star receives any 1 resource of his choice and 1 gold.

name: Theater
cardText: After building the Theater, you immediately receive 1 star.

name: Thieves’ Hideout
cardText: Place adjacent to a free road of your opponent. 1x during your turn: For 1 wool, you may place the Thieves adjacent to another region. You receive 1 resource from this region.
protectionOrRemoval: The opponent has at least 5 strength points or pays 3 stars.

name: Three-Field System
cardText: You receive up to 2 grain.

name: Tithe Barn
cardText: After building the Tithe Barn, you immediately receive either grain or wool – that is, one of the chosen resource for each of your heroes.

name: Toll Bridge
cardText: Event Plentiful Harvest: You receive 2 gold.

name: Town Hall
cardText: Place the Town Hall on your Parish Hall. At the end of your turn, you no longer pay for choosing a card.

name: Trade Master
cardText: You immediately receive 2 resources of your choice from your opponent.

name: Trade Monopoly
cardText: Demand 1, 2, or 3 resources of one type from your opponent and give him 1 resource of your choice in return.

name: Trade Ships Race
cardText: The player who owns the most trade ships receives any 1 resource of his choice. In case of a tie, each player receives any 1 resource of his choice (each must have at least 1 trade ship).

name: Trading Base
cardText: The Marketplace and the Harbor receive a second commerce point.

name: Trading Post
cardText: Place on a free road of your own. 1x during your turn: You may trade 1 resource between the two adjacent regions at a 1:1 rate.

name: Trading Station
cardText: Place on a building site of one of your opponent’s cities. 1x during your turn: For 1 gold, you may buy 1 resource of your choice from your opponent.

name: Traitor
cardText: Your opponent must show you all the cards in his hand. You may add 1 of them to your hand (in the Tournament Game, only units and action cards).
protectionOrRemoval: Lookout Tower, Heinrich the Sentinel, Pilgrimage Site, Master of the Brotherhood

name: Traveling Merchant
cardText: Each player may take up to 2 resources of his choice, paying 1 gold per resource.

name: Traveling Theater
cardText: You receive 1 star. 1x during your turn: Move the Traveling Theater onto one of your own free roads. Trade 1 resource of an adjacent region for 1 star.

name: Triumph Card
cardText: Place adjacent to any region of your choice. If you come out victorious after a Barbarian Attack, instead of taking 2 resources you also may rotate the Triumph Card to the next higher level.

name: University
cardText: Formerly, there was a hedge-tavern here. Now there are two of them next door.

name: Village School
cardText: After building the Village School, you immediately receive up to 2 stars. You receive another 1 star each time the event Trade occurs.

name: Voyage of Plunder
cardText: If your opponent has more victory points, he must give you 2 resources of your choice. If he isn’t in the lead, you only receive one resource.

name: Wainwright
cardText: 1x during your turn: You may move resources between two regions of the same type or trade 3 resources of your choice for 1 different resource.

name: Walther, Sage of the Gold Field
cardText: Place adjacent to a gold field region with at least 1 gold. Pay this gold. If the number of the adjoining gold field region is rolled during the production roll, rotate Walther to the next higher level.

name: Weaver's Shop
cardText: Doubles the wool production of the neighboring pastures.

name: White Raven Tavern
cardText: 1x during your turn: Pay 1 gold and roll the dice! If a “1” or “2” is rolled, you do not receive any resources; is a “3”, “4”, or “5” is rolled, you receive 1 resource; if a “6” is rolled, you receive 2 resources.

name: Wise Compensation
cardText: You may build 1 city for free (without paying resources).

name: Wise Protection
cardText: Your opponent must show you his hand of cards. If it contains an actiion attack card, he must place all cards in his hand under any matching draw stacks (under any matching draw stacks of his own).
protectionOrRemoval: Pilgrimage Site, Master of the Brotherhood

name: Wolfgang the Street Performer
cardText: Celebration: You may add 1 resource to each region adjacent to Wolfgang.
protectionOrRemoval: If you take something, your opponent may place Wolfgang in his principality if he pays 2 gold for the takeover.

name: Wool Ship
cardText: During your turn, you may trade 2 wool for any 1 other resource as often as you wish.

name: Year of Plenty
cardText: Each region gets 1 resource for each adjacent Storehouse and Abbey, provided that storage space is available.

name: Yule
cardText: Shuffle the event card stack as performed at the beginning of the game. Afterwards, draw an event card again.
